alert.note: Alert for Hendricks; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:54AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hendricks and northeastern Putnam Counties through 330 AM EDT... At 254 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Danville, or 19 miles southeast of Crawfordsville, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Danville around 305 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Plainfield. This includes Interstate 70 near mile marker 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
